1.verse: Salutation - Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Phile′mon our beloved fellow worker

2.verse: and Ap′phia our sister and Archip′pus our fellow soldier, and the church in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I thank my God always when I remember you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of your love and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and all the saints,

6.verse: and I pray that the sharing of your faith may promote the knowledge of all the good that is ours in Christ.

7.verse: For I have derived much joy and comfort from your love, my brother, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you.

8.verse: Paul’s Plea for Onesimus - Accordingly, though I am bold enough in Christ to command you to do what is required,

9.verse: yet for love’s sake I prefer to appeal to you—I, Paul, an ambassador and now a prisoner also for Christ Jesus—

10.verse: I appeal to you for my child, Ones′imus, whose father I have become in my imprisonment.

11.verse: (Formerly he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful to you and to me.)

12.verse: I am sending him back to you, sending my very heart.

13.verse: I would have been glad to keep him with me, in order that he might serve me on your behalf during my imprisonment for the gospel;

14.verse: but I preferred to do nothing without your consent in order that your goodness might not be by compulsion but of your own free will.

15.verse: Perhaps this is why he was parted from you for a while, that you might have him back for ever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave but more than a slave, as a beloved brother, especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: So if you consider me your partner, receive him as you would receive me.

18.verse: If he has wronged you at all, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, write this with my own hand, I will repay it—to say nothing of your owing me even your own self.

20.verse: Yes, brother, I want some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

22.verse: At the same time, prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping through your prayers to be granted to you.

23.verse: Final Greetings and Benediction - Ep′aphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you,

24.verse: and so do Mark, Aristar′chus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
